item.title: Presentation at NETSCI2020
item.description:
Our work, fruit of the collaboration started at the great Complexity72h workshop, has been presented at NETSCI2020 by Benjamin! If you want more info, you can have a look at the preprint or at the slides of the presentation.

Attachments

  • netsci_2020_presentation.pdf
  • arxiv_Prep_HIV_Gonorrhea.pdf

item.title: "The COVID-19 online shadow economy" is out on arxiv!
item.description: In this work we study the effect of the COVID-19 pandemic on illicit online trade. We monitor 23 dark web marketplaces from January to July, finding the presence of different kinds of COVID-19 related listings: PPEs, medicines (e.g. hydroxychloroquine) and medical frauds (e.g. vaccines). We measure their presence throughout the whole time period, showing correlations with public attention, using twitter and wikipedia, and misinformation. We finally show the indirect effect of the pandemic on these platforms, evidenced by an increase in mentions of delay and sales in non COVID-19 related listings.
